pullRequest.body:
Define the limit in profinite groups as a profinite group.
Co-authored-by: Jujian Zhang <jujian.zhang1998@outlook.com> Nailin Guan <3571819596@qq.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance : Group (Profinite.limitCone (F â‹™ profiniteGrpToProfinite.{max v u})).pt`
`+ instance : Limits.HasLimit F`
`+ instance : Limits.PreservesLimits profiniteGrpToProfinite.{u}`
`+ instance : TopologicalGroup (Profinite.limitCone (F â‹™ profiniteGrpToProfinite.{max v u})).pt`
`+ instance : profiniteGrpToProfinite.Faithful := {`
`+ limit`
`+ limitCone`
`+ limitConeIsLimit`
`+ limitConePtAux`
`+ profiniteGrpToProfinite`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

To prove that the functor from profinite groups to profinite sets preserves limits, I would suggest using https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Limits/Preserves/Basic.html#CategoryTheory.Limits.preservesLimitOfPreservesLimitCone applied to `Profinite.limitCone`.

> To prove that the functor from profinite groups to profinite sets preserves limits, I would suggest using https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Limits/Preserves/Basic.html#CategoryTheory.Limits.preservesLimitOfPreservesLimitCone applied to `Profinite.limitCone`.

Thank a lot, I just got some ugly things because of lacking this.
Did you forget to remove `awaiting-author`? It LGTM now, just one minor comment above

Thanks!

Could you also add a `PreservesLimits profiniteGrpToProfinite` instance? It shouldn't be too hard using what you already have
This should move higher up in the file, by the `HasForget2`Â instances.

```suggestion
def limitConePtAux : Subgroup (Î  j : J, F.obj j) where
  carrier := {x | âˆ€ â¦ƒi j : Jâ¦„ (Ï€ : i âŸ¶ j), F.map Ï€ (x i) = x j}
```

```suggestion
instance : Group (Profinite.limitCone (F â‹™ profiniteGrpToProfinite.{max v w'})).pt :=
  inferInstanceAs (Group (limit F))

instance : TopologicalGroup (Profinite.limitCone (F â‹™ profiniteGrpToProfinite.{max v w'})).pt :=
  inferInstanceAs (TopologicalGroup (limit F))
```

```suggestion
  pt := ofProfinite (Profinite.limitCone (F â‹™ profiniteGrpToProfinite.{max v w'})).pt
  Ï€ :=
```
should `ofLimit ` still exist as an abbrev? This would save some writing.
I think `ofLimit` is unnecessary. Now you can access it via `(ProfiniteGrp.limitCone _).pt`
But that would appear at a lot of places in the incoming PRs, I think this at least reduce writing and suffix (I don't think this would be easy to read)
If you want to add `abbrev ProfiniteGrp.limit (F) : ProfiniteGrp := (ProfiniteGrp.limitCone F).pt`, that's fine. But not the old `ofLimit`

```suggestion
      continuous_toFun := by
        exact (continuous_apply j).comp (continuous_iff_le_induced.mpr fun U a => a) }
    naturality := by
      intro i j f
      simp only [Functor.const_obj_obj, Functor.comp_obj,
        Functor.const_obj_map, Category.id_comp, Functor.comp_map]
      congr
      exact funext fun x => (x.2 f).symm }
```
These can be generated from a `@[simps]` attribute on `limitCone`.
How to solve the normal form problem?

Tag `limitCone`Â with `@[simps]` and write `attribute [nolint simpNF] limitCone_Ï€_app_toFun` below.

I think this nolint is fine, but if these lemmas aren't used in your followup PRs, I would just remove them for now. We can always add a `simps` attribute later if needed. For example, `Profinite.limitCone` doesn't have `simps`.
sorry, how to write `attribute [nolint simpNF] ` ? Although I think removing it is fine.

I mean

```lean
@[simps]
def limitCone ... := ...

attribute [nolint simpNF] limitCone_Ï€_app_toFun
```

But if you think it's fine, just remove these lemmas and skip the `simps` attribute as well.
I'm not sure this is a good `simp` lemma. Generally, you'd want to use the API forÂ `IsLimit` instead of definitional properties of a limit cone.
This is generated by simps, because of the normal form problem it is moved out side. maybe the simps isn't good at all
I would just remove this lemma if you don't have a specific use for it in mind

```suggestion
/-- Auxiliary construction to obtain the group structure on the limit of profinite groups. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The explicit limit cone in `ProfiniteGrp`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- `ProfiniteGrp.limitCone` is a limit cone. -/
```

```suggestion
    apply profiniteGrpToProfinite.map_injective
```
This instance doesn't need a name if you follow another suggestion of mine below.
This module docstring needs to be updated.

I would suggest either removing this docstring completely, or only mentioning `ProfiniteGrp.limitCone`Â and `ProfiniteGrp.limitConeIsLimit`, which are the only important constructions in this section.

```suggestion
section Limits

/- In this section, we construct limits in the category of profinite groups. -/
```
There is another incoming section that `ProfiniteGrp` is limit `FiniteGrp`, do you mean to merge the two?
I would suggest putting that incoming section in a separate file, that's what's done in the `Profinite`Â API

```suggestion
```

I think two universes is enough throughout the whole file, so you should switch to using `u` and `v`.

```suggestion
* `ProfiniteGrp.limitCone` : The explicit limit cone in `ProfiniteGrp`.
```

```suggestion
/-- The functor mapping a profinite group to its underlying profinite space -/
```

```suggestion
/-! In this section, we construct limits in the category of profinite groups. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The abbreviation for the limit of `ProfiniteGrp`s. -/
```

I'm a bit sad to see that this is necessary (rather than just calling `ext`). It indicates to me that perhaps we haven't set up `@[ext]` lemmas sufficiently for `TopCat`.

Doesn't need to block this PR, I'll pass that decision back to @dagurtomas. :-)
Let me investigate a bit

I don't have time to dig more so I'd recommend that we just merge this. I added a TODO. 

Let me just note that even adding the lemma
```lean 
@[ext]
lemma limitCone_ext {J : Type v} [SmallCategory J] {F : J â¥¤ ProfiniteGrp.{max v u}}
    {x y : (limitCone F).pt} (h : âˆ€ i, x.1 i = y.1 i) : x = y := Subtype.ext (funext fun i â†¦ h i)
```
wasn't enough to get the `ext`Â tactic to work.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Group/Profinite): limits in the category of profinite groups

source.title: feat(Topology/Group/Profinite):  Profinite group is limit of finite group
